title: White House Distances Trump From Initial Response to Minnesota Killing
summary: Officials clearly understood that the fatal shooting of a demonstrator posed one of the gravest political threats to President Trump since his inauguration.

title: Our Photographer Describes the Scene After the Pretti Shooting
summary: David Guttenfelder, a Times photographer based in Minneapolis, describes what he saw at the scene where Alex Jeffrey Pretti had been killed by federal agents.

title: Democrats Embrace a Shutdown Fight They Wanted to Avoid
summary: After a second fatal shooting of a U.S. citizen in Minneapolis, Democrats say public opinion is on their side and they are willing to risk a backlash to counter what they see as police-state tactics.

title: Thousands of Flights Canceled Monday After Snowstorm
summary: Delays and cancellations persisted a day after more than 11,000 flights were canceled. Airports in the Northeastern U.S. were hit the hardest.

title: Scenes From the Winter Storm
summary: Images from across much of the United States illuminate snow-covered streets and the storm’s aftermath.

title: As U.S. Warships Get Closer, Iran Ramps Up Threats to Retaliate
summary: Iran and its militia allies say they will respond aggressively in the region if attacked. A U.S. aircraft carrier and warships are approaching the region.

title: Home Sourdough Bakers Are Turning Their Hobbies Into Full-Time Jobs
summary: Home bakers are finding devoted customer bases that allow them to stay home with family and still make a decent living — but they do have get up in the middle of the night.

title: On Venezuela and Greenland, Many Trump Fans Give Him the Benefit of the Doubt
summary: At least so far, President Trump has managed to bring along even those conservative supporters who are skeptical of foreign interventions.

title: NATO Chief Says Europe Is ‘Dreaming’ if It Thinks It Can Defend Itself Without U.S.
summary: Mark Rutte, the secretary general of the alliance, told members of the European Parliament that President Trump was “doing a lot of good stuff.”

title: Under Biden Administration, Justice Dept. Began Examining Ilhan Omar’s Finances
summary: The inquiry, initiated by the U.S. attorney’s office in Washington, appears to have stalled for lack of evidence.

title: The ‘R-Word’ Returns, Dismaying Those Who Fought to Oust It
summary: The term, long considered a slur for those with intellectual disabilities, is seeing a resurgence on social media and across the political right.

title: How Bad Are A.I. Delusions? We Asked People Treating Them.
summary: Dozens of doctors and therapists said chatbots had led their patients to psychosis, isolation and unhealthy habits.

title: Yann LeCun, an A.I. Pioneer, Warns the Tech ‘Herd’ Could Hit a Dead End
summary: Yann LeCun helped create the technology behind today’s chatbots. Now he says many tech companies are on the wrong path to creating intelligent machines.

title: Israel Recovers Body of Ran Gvili From Gaza, Closing a Chapter
summary: The recovery of Master Sgt. Ran Gvili’s body paves the way for the next stage of the Gaza cease-fire plan, though the path forward is unclear.

title: These Liberals Listen to Right-Wing Podcasts to Leave Their Media Comfort Zone
summary: To get outside their bubbles — and crib some tactics — members of a listening club are plunging themselves into a world they had once avoided.

title: New Videos of the Beckham Feud Are Fake. Nobody Seems to Care.
summary: A.I.-generated content of Victoria Beckham has spread as wedding drama has engulfed the celebrity clan and the public has clamored for receipts (even fabricated ones).

title: The War in Minnesota Is for Our Phones
summary: We need to protect our right to carry cameras to document ICE’s violence.

title: ‘We Are Creating the Conditions for a Catastrophe’: Three Columnists on the Shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis
summary: On immigration raids, the shooting death of Alex Pretti and where we go from here.

title: Trump Changes Course in Minnesota
summary: Also, large parts of the U.S. are dangerously cold. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Private Jet Crashes at Maine Airport, Killing 6
summary: A Bombardier Challenger 600 crashed during takeoff Sunday at the Bangor airport, officials said.

title: 430,000-Year-Old Wooden Tools Are the Oldest Ever Found
summary: The finding, along with the discovery of a 500,000-year-old hammer made of bone, indicates that our human ancestors were making tools even earlier than archaeologists thought.

title: Thomas Fogarty, 91, Who Helped Revolutionize Vascular Surgery, Dies
summary: Drawing on his love of fly-fishing, he developed a balloon catheter that removes blood clots from patients’ limbs in a minimally invasive way. It has saved millions of lives.

title: A Year After DC Plane Crash, Concerns About Airport’s Safety Continue
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration says it has reduced traffic in and out of the airport and designed safer routes. Crash victims’ families want more.
